Test.Description:
The test declares volatile double variable v and starts the thread which continuously increments v.
Master thread also saves the reference to itself into variable t. Master thread then continuously makes the following assignments:
v1 = v; v2 = t.v; v3 = v;
and checks that v2 is not greater than v3. Failing this means that v3 holds actually the cached value of v used for v1 which in turn violates rules for volatile variables.
The procedure is repeated until timeout specified by delay parameter is reached.
Covered assertions assert_thread110 assert_thread106 assert_thread104
